meaningMnemonic: You know the kanji 込 means <kanji>into</kanji>. This verb is transitive, meaning you are doing the action. If you “do something into something” you are putting it into that thing. So this means <vocabulary>to put in</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to load something</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic:
Lucky for you, the reading you learned with the kanji is the one you use here. In case you need a hand with the okurigana, here’s a mnemonic for you:

You always try <vocabulary>to put in</vocabulary> your emotions into the <reading>mail</reading> (める) you send. You don't just load your mail with words, but also with emotions, to make it truly heartfelt mail.
